subject: Re: when and why an AssertionFails
msgSnippet: ... It occurs becasue whatever the assertion (i.e. a call to assertXXXX) is claiming to be true, isn t. For example: int x = 1; int y = 1; assertEquals(3,
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, naren_nair@h... wrote:
> hello guys
> i am a new person in this field
> i need to know why and when an AssertionFailedError occures
> is it beacuse of the way we do testing or some units need not be
> tested. or is it beacuse of the types of assertions we use (the wrong
> assertion at the wrong place)

It occurs becasue whatever the assertion (i.e. a call to assertXXXX)
is claiming to be true, isn't.

For example:

int x = 1;
int y = 1;
assertEquals(3, x+y);

will cause an AssertionFailedError to be thrown.

Dave
